newsitem.title: GUATEMALA: Former Guatemalan president Peralta, 88, dies.
newsitem.headline: Former Guatemalan president Peralta, 88, dies.

text.p: Former Guatemalan President Col. Alfredo Enrique Peralta Azurdia died early Wednesday morning in a military hospital, officials said. He was 88.
Peralta died of natural causes, army spokesman Col. Edgar Noe Palacios told Reuters. Palacios said he had no information on surviving family members.

The army installed Peralta, then defence minister, as president in 1963, a year after the first Guatemalan guerrilla groups formed and nine years after civilian rule was overturned by a CIA-backed coup.
The leftist rebels started an armed struggle that lasted more than three decades before a historic peace agreement last December.

During Peralta's three years in office, long-running border disputes between Guatemala and Belize boiled over and Guatemala threatened war against its tiny neighbour, then a British colony known as British Honduras.
Because of the dispute with Belize, Guatemala's diplomatic relations with Britain were suspended. They have yet to be normalised.
In 1966, elected president Julio Cesar Mendez Montenegro replaced Peralta.
